stance_1: I am curious about meat's environmental impact
stance_2: I feel sad meat consumption affects the environment
justification: The interviewee's curiosity about the environmental impact of meat is explicitly linked to her sadness about learning of the impact.

stance_1: I am curious about meat's environmental impact
stance_2: I have not changed meat-eating habits due to environmental concerns
justification: The interviewee states she has not changed her habits yet, but her curiosity about the environmental impact is linked to her consideration of the issue.

stance_1: I am used to eating meat
stance_2: I eat meat at every meal
justification: The habit of eating meat regularly supports eating meat at every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: I eat meat to get protein
justification: The interviewee states getting protein is a reason for eating meat at every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: I love the taste of meat
justification: Enjoyment of the taste of meat supports eating meat at every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: My family eats meat at every meal
justification: The interviewee explains her family and herself share the same meat-eating habits.

stance_1: I prepare meat-based meals for my family
stance_2: My family eats meat at every meal
justification: The interviewee directly states her family eats meat at every meal because she prepares the meals.

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
stance_2: I prepare meat-based meals for my family
justification: Her regular meat-eating leads to her preparing meat-based meals for her family.

stance_1: I am used to eating meat
stance_2: I prepare meat-based meals for my family
justification: Her habituation to meat supports preparing meat-based meals for her family.

stance_1: I eat meat to get protein

stance_1: I am used to eating meat

justification: Her family environment contributed to her being used to eating meat.

stance_1: I love the taste of meat

stance_1: I eat meat at every meal
